00085 struct mdc_rpc_lock {
00087         struct mutex            rpcl_mutex;
00089         struct lookup_intent    *rpcl_it;
00091         int                     rpcl_fakes;
00092 };
00093 
00094 #define MDC_FAKE_RPCL_IT ((void *)0x2c0012bfUL)
00095 
00096 static inline void mdc_init_rpc_lock(struct mdc_rpc_lock *lck)
00097 {
00098         mutex_init(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00099         lck->rpcl_it = NULL;
00100 }
00101 
00102 static inline void mdc_get_rpc_lock(struct mdc_rpc_lock *lck,
00103                                     struct lookup_intent *it)
00104 {
00105         ENTRY;
00106 
00107         if (it != NULL && (it->it_op == IT_GETATTR || it->it_op == IT_LOOKUP ||
00108                            it->it_op == IT_LAYOUT || it->it_op == IT_READDIR))
00109                 return;
00110 
00111         /* This would normally block until the existing request finishes.
00112          * If fail_loc is set it will block until the regular request is
00113          * done, then set rpcl_it to MDC_FAKE_RPCL_IT.  Once that is set
00114          * it will only be cleared when all fake requests are finished.
00115          * Only when all fake requests are finished can normal requests
00116          * be sent, to ensure they are recoverable again. */
00117  again:
00118         mutex_lock(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00119 
00120         if (CFS_FAIL_CHECK_QUIET(OBD_FAIL_MDC_RPCS_SEM)) {
00121                 lck->rpcl_it = MDC_FAKE_RPCL_IT;
00122                 lck->rpcl_fakes++;
00123                 mutex_unlock(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00124                 return;
00125         }
00126 
00127         /* This will only happen when the CFS_FAIL_CHECK() was
00128          * just turned off but there are still requests in progress.
00129          * Wait until they finish.  It doesn't need to be efficient
00130          * in this extremely rare case, just have low overhead in
00131          * the common case when it isn't true. */
00132         while (unlikely(lck->rpcl_it == MDC_FAKE_RPCL_IT)) {
00133                 mutex_unlock(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00134                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1) / 4);
00135                 goto again;
00136         }
00137 
00138         LASSERT(lck->rpcl_it == NULL);
00139         lck->rpcl_it = it;
00140 }
00141 
00142 static inline void mdc_put_rpc_lock(struct mdc_rpc_lock *lck,
00143                                     struct lookup_intent *it)
00144 {
00145         if (it != NULL && (it->it_op == IT_GETATTR || it->it_op == IT_LOOKUP ||
00146                            it->it_op == IT_LAYOUT || it->it_op == IT_READDIR))
00147                 goto out;
00148 
00149         if (lck->rpcl_it == MDC_FAKE_RPCL_IT) { /* OBD_FAIL_MDC_RPCS_SEM */
00150                 mutex_lock(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00151 
00152                 LASSERTF(lck->rpcl_fakes > 0, "%d\n", lck->rpcl_fakes);
00153                 lck->rpcl_fakes--;
00154 
00155                 if (lck->rpcl_fakes == 0)
00156                         lck->rpcl_it = NULL;
00157 
00158         } else {
00159                 LASSERTF(it == lck->rpcl_it, "%p != %p\n", it, lck->rpcl_it);
00160                 lck->rpcl_it = NULL;
00161         }
00162 
00163         mutex_unlock(&lck->rpcl_mutex);
00164  out:
00165         EXIT;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static inline void mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00169                                         struct lookup_intent *it)
00170 {
00171         struct client_obd *cli = &req->rq_import->imp_obd->u.cli;
00172         __u32 opc;
00173         __u16 tag;
00174 
00175         opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
00176         tag = obd_get_mod_rpc_slot(cli, opc, it);
00177         lustre_msg_set_tag(req->rq_reqmsg, tag);
00178 }
00179 
00180 static inline void mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00181                                         struct lookup_intent *it)
00182 {
00183         struct client_obd *cli = &req->rq_import->imp_obd->u.cli;
00184         __u32 opc;
00185         __u16 tag;
00186 
00187         opc = lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg);
00188         tag = lustre_msg_get_tag(req->rq_reqmsg);
00189         obd_put_mod_rpc_slot(cli, opc, it, tag);
00190 }
00191 
00192 
00207 static inline void mdc_update_max_ea_from_body(struct obd_export *exp,
00208                                                struct mdt_body *body)
00209 {
00210         if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLMODEASIZE) {
00211                 struct client_obd *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
00212                 __u32 def_easize;
00213 
00214                 if (cli->cl_max_mds_easize < body->mbo_max_mdsize)
00215                         cli->cl_max_mds_easize = body->mbo_max_mdsize;
00216 
00217                 def_easize = min_t(__u32, body->mbo_max_mdsize,
00218                                    OBD_MAX_DEFAULT_EA_SIZE);
00219                 cli->cl_default_mds_easize = def_easize;
00220         }
00221 }

00224 /* mdc/mdc_locks.c */
00225 int it_open_error(int phase, struct lookup_intent *it);
00226 
00227 static inline bool cl_is_lov_delay_create(unsigned int flags)
00228 {
00229         return  (flags & O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_1_8) != 0 ||
00230                 (flags & O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_MASK) == O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_MASK;
00231 }
00232 
00233 static inline void cl_lov_delay_create_clear(unsigned int *flags)
00234 {
00235         if ((*flags & O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_1_8) != 0)
00236                 *flags &= ~O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_1_8;
00237         if ((*flags & O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_MASK) == O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_MASK)
00238                 *flags &= ~O_LOV_DELAY_CREATE_MASK;
00239 }
